bug.author: nikochiko
bug.summary: Update sample session for build from source instruction docs
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source_windows>https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source_windows</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source>https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
The sample sessions given in the docs are old (Bazel 0.15.1, TensorFlow 1.11, python 2.7) A new session-copy with the more recent TensorFlow 2.x with Bazel 0.26.1 would be more helpful. Also, python 2.7 is reaching end-of-life in Jan 2020. <denchmark-h:h3>Submit a pull request?</denchmark-h>
Are you planning to also submit a pull request to fix the issue? Yes.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nikochiko>@nikochiko</denchmark-link> Are you saying the instructions to install TF from source uses Bazel 0.15.1? I see <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source_windows#setup_for_windows>here</denchmark-link> Bazel 0.24.1. Am I missing something here. Can you please describe with little more details? Thanks!

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jvishnuvardhan>@jvishnuvardhan</denchmark-link> I don't mean in the text instructions. There is a sample configuration session on the instructions page. It drops down with a '+' button. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37668193/68988565-8d137780-085f-11ea-9ca9-ce65db0abd28.PNG></denchmark-link>
It is very outdated. Having a newer version can help with installation since many users are facing build failures.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/nikochiko>@nikochiko</denchmark-link> I agree that the sample configuration is with an older version but it an example to any user how to configure. It is difficult to update this configuration every time when a dependency (python/CUDA/Bazel etc) is changed. Thanks! <denchmark-link:https://github.com/MarkDaoust>@MarkDaoust</denchmark-link> Can you Please take a look at it. Are we updating this in the near future? Thanks!

I am closing this issue as I think this issue was resolved. There is another with newer versions in the build-from-source for linux/MacOS <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source>page</denchmark-link> . Thanks! <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46058173/98324483-3b4c8b80-1fa1-11eb-9154-69cc20fd5fad.png></denchmark-link>

Are you satisfied with the resolution of your issue? <denchmark-link:https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfaP12TRhd9xSxjXZjcZFNXPGk4kc1-qMdv3gc6bEP90vY1ew/viewform?entry.85265664=Yes&entry.2137816233=https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/33906>Yes</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfaP12TRhd9xSxjXZjcZFNXPGk4kc1-qMdv3gc6bEP90vY1ew/viewform?entry.85265664=No&entry.2137816233=https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/33906>No</denchmark-link>
